content:
1. E00000: User would like to manage an aspect of their system or service account profile such as owner permissions, display name, job title, address or alias.
	2. 00000b: a customer wants transfer funds between their accounts at different banks or financial institutions.
	3. 00e000 : Adding/Removing people (either users or owners/admins) to/from group distribution list (DL), mailing list, listserv, shared mailbox, mail group, mail alias, Microsoft Office 365 group, etc. Request to create or delete DL, etc.
	4. B00000:  a customer wants to close their account with the bank.
	5. 00b000:  a customer wants to deposit cash or a check into their account at the bank.
	6. 0e0000 : issues with: accessing e-mail (but not if password-related), e-mails not updating, e-mails not being received, accepting external emails, reporting spam or phishing. 
	7. 0b0000:  a customer wants withdraw cash from their account at the bank.
        8. 0000e0: User is checking in for an appointment or joining the waiting line for the walk-up tech lounge or on-site help desk support.

You are provided with the list of eight intents. Each intent has Intent Id consisting of 6 alphanumeric characters. 
There was a glitch in the system resulting in loosing of some types of data. In your case the intent Ids lost their initial values and now consist of 5 "0"s in different combinations with 1 letter. It may be letter "b" or "e" either uppercase or lowercase. This will be the main marker for you. Letter "b" was previously used in the Intent Ids related to the bank sector, letter "e" was used in the Intent Ids related to the IT. 
Your task will be to classify those intents in the list above  and to put them in a corresponding group. Return your answer in json. When responding, include the key "output", where the keys of this dictionary  will be the "bank", and "IT" and sub dictionary are the intent Ids associated with those groups.
